description: From Middle English late, lat, from Old English læt (“slow; slack, lax, negligent; late”), from Proto-West Germanic *lat, from Proto-Germanic *lataz (“slow, lazy”).

entries.meaning: Near the end of a period of time.
examples: The seedlings appeared to be coming along nicely until a late frost killed them.

entries.meaning: Specifically, near the end of the day.
examples: It was getting late and I was tired.

entries.meaning: (usually not comparable) Associated with the end of a period.
examples: Late Latin is less fully inflected than classical Latin.

entries.meaning: Not arriving or occurring until after an expected time.
examples: The flowers were late in blooming because of the prolonged cold weather.
Panos was so late that he arrived at the meeting after Antonio, who had the excuse of being in hospital for most of the night.

entries.meaning: Levied as a surcharge on a payment received after a deadline.
examples: The power company suspended late fees during the pandemic.

entries.meaning: Not having had an expected menstrual period.
examples: I'm late, honey. Could you buy a test?

entries.meaning: (not comparable, euphemistic) Deceased, dead: used particularly when speaking of the dead person's actions while alive. (Generally must be preceded by a possessive or an article, commonly "the"; see usage notes. Can itself only precede the person's name, never follow it.)
examples: Her late husband had left her well provided for.
The piece was composed by the late Igor Stravinsky.

entries.meaning: Existing or holding some position not long ago, but not now; departed, or gone out of office.
Recent — relative to the noun it modifies.
(astronomy) Of a star or class of stars, cooler than the sun.
After a deadline has passed, past a designated time.
examples: We drove as fast as we could, but we still arrived late.

entries.meaning: Formerly, especially in the context of service in a military unit.
examples: Colonel Easterwood, late of the 34th Carbines, was a guest at the dinner party.
The Hendersons will all be there / Late of Pablo Fanque's Fair / What a scene!

entries.meaning: (informal) A shift (scheduled work period) that takes place late in the day or at night.
